name: Maggie L Walker National Historic Site
description: Maggie Lena Walker devoted her life to civil rights advancement, economic empowerment, and educational opportunities for Jim Crow-era African Americans and women. As a bank president, newspaper editor, and fraternal leader, Walker served as an inspiration of pride and progress. Today, Walkerâ€™s home is preserved as a tribute to her enduring legacy of vision, courage, and determination.
shortDescription: Maggie Lena Walker devoted her life to civil rights advancement, economic empowerment, and educational opportunities for Jim Crow-era African Americans and women. As a bank president, newspaper editor...

operatingHours.description:
The site will be open Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays for reserved group tours, and Fridays and Saturdays for walk-ins only.

The site is closed on Thanksgiving, December 25th and January 1st.

climate.weatherDescription: Summer is hot and humid, spring and winter are pleasant/mild, winter can be cold and occasionally snowy.

images.title: Maggie L. Walker National Historic Site
images.altText: Maggie L. Walker's home and adjacent buildings
images.caption: Maggie L. Walker's stately home was located on a street dubbed "Quality Row."

images.title: The Back Parlor of the Historic Walker Home
images.altText: The back parlor with piano, couch, floor lamp and fireplace
images.caption: The back parlor served as an entertainment location for the Walker family

images.title: The Library of the Walker House
images.altText: A room with a wall of full bookcases, chairs and several diplomas on the wall
images.caption: The Library served as both a relaxing place and a work place for Mrs. Walker

images.title: The Maggie L. Walker Visitor Center
images.altText: 3 red brick, two-story buildings, with a US flag flying and an overcast sky
images.caption: The Maggie L. Walker Visitor Center serves as a gateway into Mrs. Walker's life in Jackson Ward
